content: rrriiibbbbbbeeeddd hhhaaattt a great project if you want to add texture into crochet the first few rounds require a certain amount of patience but after that it s repeats until the last row the circumference of the finished hat measures 53 cm 21 inches and is designed to be worn pulled low over the ears if you prefer a shorter version cut the number of rounds in the main body of the hat a matching scarf pattern is also available on ravelry yarn 50g james c brett marble - half a ball or 50g or so of a dk yarn of your choice hook 6mm gauge 4 inches = 12 double_crochet and 7 5 row skill intermediate special stitches fpdc and fptc lefties please go to the end of the pdf for explanation and pictures 1 working into a 3 yarn over and row of double draw loop back crochet yarn over under post 2 insert hook 4 yarn over and behind the post of draw through 2 the next double_crochet from loops on hook yarn right to left over and raw through remaining 2 loops on hook as you would a normal double_crochet both the fpdc and fptc stitches are formed in the same way to complete a fptc yarn over twice in step 1 and to complete yarn over and draw through 2 loops on hook an extra time
